english: The Fee-Charging Standards of Free Trade Zones at Commercial Ports
title: 商港自由貿易港區收費標準

articles.content: These Fee-Charging Standards are enacted pursuant to the provisions set forth in Paragraph 2, Article 45 of the Act for the Establishment and Management of Free Trade Zones.
The fee for examining one application of a free-trade-zone enterprise or non-free-port enterprise to operate within designated Free Trade Zones shall be NT$2,000.

Personnel or vehicles entering free trade zones shall apply to Maritime and Port Bureau (hereinafter referred to as the “Bureau”) for long-term access permits. The fees for applying the said permits are given below:
1. Personnel long-term access permit: NT$200 per person.
2. Vehicle long-term access permit: NT$200 per vehicle.
All fees stipulated in these standards shall be paid to the designated office within the specified period of time according to the payment list issued by Bureau.
Where the fees have not been paid according to these standards, the provisions of the Charges and Fees Act shall apply.
These standards shall come into force from the date of promulgation.
